result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pre-trial conference on April 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

21CF507 2nd amended information.
22CF54 Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:12 PM Defendant Jeffrey Charles Masley appeared in court, Attorney Eric Sheets for Jeffrey Charles Masley appeared in court, Attorney Kelly A Cassidy for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Cases heard today are 21CF507 and 22CF54.

Atty Sheets will submit a written waiver for each of the cases.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Supervision Status Report dated 02-03-2022
Eric Sheets
Initial Appearance set for February 7, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 2

Covers both 22GF47 and 21CF507.
Participate in the Portage County Day Report Program and comply with the requirements for assessment and reporting.
Comply with conditions in all his open bonds.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy  appears in court.  Cases 22GF47 new charges and 21CF507 Return on Warrant
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Eric Sheets  appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of OWI and Bail Jumping. 
Atty Sheets does not have anything to state about the facts of the case and should be appointed on the new case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Sheets objections as to bond are heard. 
BY THE COURT: Court sets bond and quashes warrant in 21CF507.
$1,250 cash bond to cover both offenses
